poem:
Tofu's Terroir

In the cool aisle of the market,  
where taste is wrapped in plastic,  
I ponder the humble block,  
its flavor steeped in whispers  
of far-off soil and sun.  
Who knew beneath its pale skin  
lurked stories of earth and rain,  
waiting to unfurl on the tongue?  
An unassuming masterpiece  
of curdled milk and sea.
